Earlier today, Governor Murphy announced that all New Jersey Schools will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. We share your disappointment, but we know this is a necessary step for the safety of our students and staff. Our remote learning program will continue for the remainder of the school year and will follow our current school calendar (the last day of the school year remains June 18). Based on parent feedback (via survey and other means), the district will continue to make improvements/modifications to the remote learning experience to ensure that it is a positive and effective one for our students.

We remain committed to honoring our end of the year traditions in all schools, although they will look a little different. Details will be shared in the coming weeks by your building principal.

We miss our students and staff, and can not wait until we see them again.

Hopewell Valley Parenting Conference Postponed

In light of the current uncertainty regarding the COVID-19 virus, the decision has been made to postpone the Hopewell Valley Parenting Conference scheduled for March 28, 2020. This was a prudent decision considering the possible health risks.

Plans to reschedule the conference in the fall are currently underway. The program will be identical, so those who have already registered will automatically be re-registered for the new date once it is established.

We would like to thank everyone involved in planning this conference for all their hard work over the last 18 months to bring this event to our community. As soon as a new date has been established, we will send an additional communication to the community.

Sincerely,
Hopewell Valley Parenting Conference Partners

Heidi Kahme
Hopewell Valley Municipal Alliance

Thomas A. Smith, Ed.D
Hopewell Valley Regional School District

post_text: The student body at Toll Gate Grammar School honored the legacy of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. today by participating in Day of Service. Students assembled crayons and coloring books for Womenspace and made dog treat toys for SAVE. In addition they rustled up blankets for Colin's Kids and put together toiletries for US Service Men & Women. They also made weekend meal bags for TASK and created soft blankets for Womenspace. Students also wrote letters and drew pictures to go along with their service projects. Great job, staff and students. Dr. King would be proud.

post_text: Check out this collaborative project from students in Mrs. Cariola's Art 8 class. Each student replicated a square that was given to to them which was a part of a Vincent Van Gogh sunflower painting. Pastels were used to mimic VanGogh's painterly style of thick vivid color. The squares were attached back together to get the final result. Each student's style comes through and the imperfect matchup of the squares are part of the beauty and uniqueness of each person. On display at TMS!

Do you suffer from ANXIETY? Does your child? Partner? Learn how to cope & find hope. Join us for a special screening of "ANGST" on TUESDAY, OCTOBER 15.

Screening & Panel Discussion - Angst is an IndieFlix Original, documentary designed to raise awareness around anxiety. Hopewell Valley Municipal Alliance in cooperation with the Hopewell Valley Regional School District is proud to sponsor this film.

Two showings: 9:00 am in the Community Room at HVCHS and 6:00 pm at the HVCHS Performing Arts Center.
Doors open 15 minutes prior

Free to attend! Questions? Contact: hvmunicipalalliance@gmail.com
